CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Production stage positioned above or below the Testing and Validation stage?
SRP.A: The Production stage is positioned {below} the Testing and Validation stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Testing and Validation?
VE.A: The value of stage Testing and Validation is {55%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Prototype Development?
VE.A: The value of stage Prototype Development is {100%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Final Design Approval?
VE.A: The value of stage Final Design Approval is {33%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Prototype Development, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Production, with a value of {27%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Prototype Development to stage Testing and Validation?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Prototype Development to stage Testing and Validation is {45%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Final Design Approval to stage Production?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Final Design Approval to stage Production is {6%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 77%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 30%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 30% and 44%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval, or from stage Final Design Approval to Production?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Testing and Validation} to {Final Design Approval} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval, from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation, or from stage Final Design Approval to Production?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Prototype Development} to stage {Testing and Validation} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Prototype Development} and {Testing and Validation} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Final Design Approval} and {Production} stages.
